ships.name: Light Shuttle
ships.description: The light shuttle is a versatile spacecraft designed for exploration, diplomacy, and light cargo transport. With its compact size and agile maneuverability, the shuttle is capable of navigating through tight spaces and challenging environments.

frame.name: Frame Shuttle
frame.description: A small, reusable spacecraft designed for short-range, low-speed travel between spacecraft or planetary surfaces.

reactor.name: Chemical Reactor I
reactor.description: A basic chemical power reactor, used to generate electricity from chemical reactions.

engine.name: Impulse Drive I
engine.description: A basic low-energy propulsion system that generates thrust for interplanetary travel.

modules.name: Cargo Hold
modules.description: A module that increases a ship's cargo capacity.

modules.name: Crew Quarters
modules.description: A module that provides living space and amenities for the crew.

modules.name: Passenger Cabin
modules.description: A module that provides living space and amenities for passengers.

modules.name: Envoy Quarters
modules.description: A module that provides living space and amenities for VIP passengers or diplomatic envoys.

mounts.name: Rotary Cannon
mounts.description: A rotary cannon is a type of mounted turret that is designed to fire a high volume of rounds in rapid succession.

ships.name: Light Hauler
ships.description: A small, fast cargo ship that is designed for short-range transport of light loads.

frame.name: Frame Light Freighter
frame.description: A small, versatile spacecraft used for cargo transport and other commercial operations.

reactor.name: Chemical Reactor I
reactor.description: A basic chemical power reactor, used to generate electricity from chemical reactions.

engine.name: Ion Drive I
engine.description: An advanced propulsion system that uses ionized particles to generate high-speed, low-thrust acceleration.

mounts.name: Surveyor I
mounts.description: A basic survey probe that can be used to gather information about a mineral deposit.
